message:
Merge pull request #10103 from MicrosoftDocs/main

Auto Publish – main to live - 2025-10-22 17:07 UTC

    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/b313bc62f37e7efb6a2cb4a72ce4dd1f07835ab5/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fconcept-authentication-methods-customers.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fexternal-id%2Fcustomers%2Fconcept-authentication-methods-customers.md?ref=b313bc62f37e7efb6a2cb4a72ce4dd1f07835ab5",
    "patch": "@@ -64,7 +64,7 @@ By setting up federation with Google, you can allow users to sign in to your app\n \n The following screenshots show the sign-in with Google experience. In the sign-in page, users select **Sign-in with Google**. At that point, the user is redirected to the Google identity provider to complete the sign-in.\n \n-   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/concept-authentication-methods-customers/google-sign-in.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshots of google sign-in screens.\" border=\"false\":::\n+   :::image type=\"content\" source=\"media/concept-authentication-methods-customers/google-sign-in.png\" alt-text=\"Screenshots of Google sign-in screens.\" border=\"false\":::\n \n Learn how to [add Google as an identity provider](how-to-google-federation-customers.md).\n \n@@ -114,7 +114,7 @@ When you federate with other external identity providers—such as Facebook, Goo\n You can use the following `domain_hint` values to go directly to the sign-in page for these identity providers:\n \n - **Facebook**: `domain_hint=facebook`.  \n-- **Google**: `domain_hint=google`.  \n+- **Google**: `domain_hint=Google`.  \n - **Apple**: `domain_hint=apple`.\n - **Custom OIDC**: `domain_hint=<issuer URI>`. For a custom OIDC identity provider, use the domain part of the **Issuer URI** in the `domain_hint` syntax.\n "
  },
  {
    "sha": "546aab4f8c660ef5c2a5ecfa478643dedd7eebaa",
    "filename": "docs/identity/conditional-access/resilience-defaults.md",
    "status": "modified",
    "additions": 1,
    "deletions": 1,
    "changes": 2,
    "blob_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/blob/b313bc62f37e7efb6a2cb4a72ce4dd1f07835ab5/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fresilience-defaults.md",
    "raw_url": "https://github.com/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/raw/b313bc62f37e7efb6a2cb4a72ce4dd1f07835ab5/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fresilience-defaults.md",
    "contents_url": "https://api.github.com/repos/MicrosoftDocs/entra-docs/contents/docs%2Fidentity%2Fconditional-access%2Fresilience-defaults.md?ref=b313bc62f37e7efb6a2cb4a72ce4dd1f07835ab5",
    "patch": "@@ -71,7 +71,7 @@ When resilience defaults are disabled, the Backup Authentication Service doesn't\n \n ## Testing resilience defaults\n \n-You can't conduct a dry run using the Backup Authentication Service or simulate the result of a policy with resilience defaults enabled or disabled. Microsoft Entra runs monthly tests using the Backup Authentication Service. The sign-in logs indicate if the Backup Authentication Service issued the access token. In **Entra ID** > **Monitoring & health** > **Sign-in Logs**, add the filter \"Token issuer type == Microsoft Entra Backup Auth\" to display the logs processed by Microsoft Entra Backup Authentication Service.\n+You can't conduct a dry run using the Backup Authentication Service or simulate the result of a policy with resilience defaults enabled or disabled. Microsoft Entra runs monthly tests using the Backup Authentication Service. The scope of these tests varies. We do not test every tenant every month. To see if tokens were issued via Backup Authentication Service within your tenant, you can use the sign-in logs. In **Entra ID** > **Monitoring & health** > **Sign-in Logs**, add the filter \"Token issuer type == Microsoft Entra Backup Auth\" to display the logs processed by Microsoft Entra Backup Authentication Service.\n \n ## Configuring resilience defaults\n "
  }
]. Please summarise it in a few sentences, using UK grammar and ensure the response is formatted for markdown. Do not start the response with here is summary."}
ai_summary.Response:
This commit introduces minor updates to Microsoft Entra documentation.

One change corrects a typo in the `alt-text` for an image related to Google sign-in, and another updates the `domain_hint` value for Google federation from lowercase `google` to uppercase `Google`. Additionally, a sentence in the "Testing resilience defaults" section of the conditional access documentation has been rephrased for clarity regarding the scope and frequency of resilience default tests.
